page.title: 02TIDWORTH LANDSCAPE
page.content: Tidworth is set in a slight valley to the West of a ridge-line. The land surrounding the built-up area is lightly wooded with large open spaces reaching out towards Salisbury Plain. The ground is predominantly chalk and well drained. At Chalk Pit Hill there is an ancient burial site and also the Tidworth pumping station which pumps water to the village. There are many large grassed areas in the village and sportsfields are scattered over the area. Once on the training area to the West the landscape becomes an open plain with low scrub and grassland. There are small areas of forestry. The River Bourne runs through the village from North to South but it is only a small stream; dry in Summer and flowing in Winter and Spring. The area is well tended with new trees and flowers planted regularly by the Army.
